Research

Theme 1

  |   Multiscale investigations of the human brain

Our team focuses on integrating macroscale connectomics with brain properties derived from meso- and microscale resolutions. Such features include MRI markers of tissue microstructure, local functional properties, as well as information from nonimaging domains, including cellular, genetic, or chemical data. By enriching connectome models, this method promises to refine our understanding of healthy brain function and clarify the underlying mechanisms of brain disorders like stroke, autism, and drug-resistant epilepsy, which involve complex interactions between local and network-level disturbances.

For more details, see e.g. Larivi√®re et al., 2019, Brain Connectivity

Theme 3

  |   Typical and atypical brain development

Our team focuses integrating macroscale connectomics with brain properties derived from meso- and microscale resolutions. Such features include MRI markers of tissue microstructure, local functional properties, as well as information from nonimaging domains, including cellular, genetic, or chemical data. By enriching connectome models, this method promises to refine our understanding of healthy brain function and clarify the underlying mechanisms of brain disorders like stroke, autism, and drug-resistant epilepsy, which involve complex interactions between local and network-level disturbances.
